posts.text:
• I have emetophobia
  • My memory is really very bad :(
  • I go to school with the same hairstyle everyday
  • once I killed my own pet
  • I suck for this and I know it. I will laugh myself into a fit of uncontrollable giggles and tears at the sight of little people running.
  • I eat, eat and eat but never got fat
  • My taste in music is pop
  • never wore high heels in my life
  • i always wanted to have red eyes
  • everyday i look in the mirror and think nothing for at least 30 mins :p

Never thought I would thank the pakistani army in this way but, Thank you pakistani army! you risk your lives for protecting me and my country, not even caring about your parents,children, wives and friends. No one has the courage like you people you all never made us feel down, when you decide to do something, then you really do it no matter what comes in your way you just don’t stop.even after knowing that you’re gonna die at anytime, you don’t feel guilty to protect your country. I know these words are less to thank you all but here’s a big salute from me to the pakistani army !

once again thank you! :)

First album: Up All Night

Second Album: Take Me Home

Third Album: Midnight Memories

Fourth Album: FOUR

 

 

link for the new song fireproof: http://www.onedirectionmusic.com/#

Originally posted on Metro:

One Direction’s new album Four will be a contender to top the Christmas charts (Picture: Syco)

One Direction are looking to shake off the tag they’re just a band of ‘manufactured pretty faces’ by releasing their ‘most personal’ album yet.

The fab five – Harry Styles, Niall Horan, Zayn Malik, Liam Payne and Louis Tomlinson – have each penned tracks for their fourth studio album, titled Four.

‘It’s going to be their most personal record yet,’ a source close to the band told Metro.

The boys have been very serious about recording their best album yet, with a lot of personal lyrics and stories about their lives.

‘They’ve also been working with some new producers like Naughty Boy,’ the insider added.

The 1D boys built a recording studio to to take them on the road with them during their recent world tour, the source said.

‘They’ve been writing individually and…

Originally posted on The Thrill:

Remember Doug?

The late nineties and early two thousands were a simpler time for all of us. I personally had a sweet pair of trampoline shoes, and that time I threw my Gak at the living room ceiling to see if it would stick, I learned that those kinds of things leave a mark that will last for years.  The Thrill runs a regular feature that thrives on these simpler times, so send the best of your writing from ’93-’07 to thekenyonthrill@gmail.com!

Κυκλοφόρησε χτες το πρώτο σινγκλ μέσα από το επερχόμενο τέταρτο άλμπουμ των One Direction, το οποίο θα ακολουθήσει στα μέσα Νοεμβρίου.

Δεν θέλω να σας πω πώς μου φαίνεται, γιατί τους συμπαθώ και δεν θα ήθελα να χαλάσουμε τις καρδιές μας, αλλά έχω μια απορία: Όταν δήλωναν πρόσφατα ότι η νέα τους δισκογραφική δουλειά δεν θα είχε τόσο “φορτωμένη” παραγωγή, τί ακριβώς εννοούσαν; Εγώ στο ‘Steal My Girl’ νομίζω ότι ακούω ακριβώς το αντίθετο.

Originally posted on The Thrill:

This photo somehow applies to this article, and you should apply to write for the Thrill. ( image via assets.nydailynews.com )

Have you ever thought about writing for The Thrill? Well, you have now because you just read that question and now you can’t deny that I’ve gotten those wheels turning. So now that you’ve started Step 1 of the application process (which is “Thinking about Maybe Applying”), I’m here to tell you why you should probably move on to Step 2 (“Applying”).

You might still be skeptical, or else you’re doing that thing where you kindly tell me “Haha, yeah I’ll think about it” and then not apply. But I want you to know that I’m for real about this, and here are 5 reasons you should apply to write for The Thrill today:

Πέντε μόλις μέρες πριν την κυκλοφορία του ολοκληρωμένου δισκογραφικού τους ντεμπούτου, οι Gorgon City μας παρουσιάζουν άλλο ένα από τα τραγούδια τους!

Το Λονδρεζικο ντουέτο αυτήν τη φορά επέλεξε την συνεργασία του με την Jennifer Hudson, με τον τίτλο ‘Go All Night’.

Έχοντάς μας κακομάθει με το ‘Ready For Your Love’, το ‘Here For You’, το δικό μου αγαπημένο ‘Unmissable’, αλλά και το πιο πρόσφατο ‘Imagination’, μπορεί αυτό το νέο τραγούδι να μη μας φαίνεται και τόσο εντυπωσιακό, αλλά είναι υπεραρκετό για να μας πάει μέχρι την κυκλοφορία της Δευτέρας.

Originally posted on Blonde Mélange:

Happy October little lambs! But more importantly, HAPPY TAYLOR SWIFT “1989″ ALBUM RELEASE MONTH!!!!

I’m obsessed with T. Swift and I don’t care who knows it (AKA everyone who knows me knows it whether they care or not). My first encounter with her was actually in person at a mall in Atlanta, Georgia when I was like 16. She was brand new to the scene and was at an FYE music store signing autographs. Ready for the “so I met her and she was wonderful” part of the story? Yeah…didn’t happen. My sister and I decided we didn’t care to swing by the event because we didn’t even really know who she was.

………..I really never regret anything, but boy do I regret that day in the mall!!! Ah, hindsight is 20/20.

ANYWAY. I did at least see her gorgeous blonde curly locks that day and became a full fledged…

View original 146 more words

Originally posted on 1025 KSFM:

By Ezra Marcus

Chris Brown,Puff DaddyandMichael Jacksonhave all found themselves immortalized onLaw & Order SVU, which never hesitates to rip stories from the tabloids. Now the long running show is taking aim at a more recent scandal: the infamous Met Gala incident earlier this year.

An upcoming episode of the show, titled ?American Disgrace,? will show a fictionalized recreation of the incident, with a preview surfacing promoting the episode.

Thefight, betweenJay Z,BeyonceandSolange, wascaptured on videotape in an elevator at the Standard Hotel the night of the Met Gala. It ended up prompting a flurry of media coverage, many questioning the strength of Bey and Jay’s marriage; meanwhile, the family stood firm in its brief statements on what happened in the elevator,noting that”families have problems and we’re no different.”

Read more on Radio.com

View original

Originally posted on the girl with the vodka tonic:

If you’re a fifteen year old girl or just simply a resident of planet earth than you know that billion dollar boy-band One Direction released  “Steal My Girl” this past Monday.  The first official single from 1D’s fourth studio “Four,” it certainly does not disappoint. Let’s dive in.

The song begins with what can only be described as an EPIC PIANO RIFF.  Does it sound vaguely like a punk-rock band’s 2006 song? Maybe, but that is besides the point because it is awesome.

Keyboard Cat Rocking Out to 1D’s “Steal My Girl”

Then the sweet, sweet angelic voice of Zayn fills your ears:

“She’s been my queen
Since we were sixteen
We want the same things,
We dream the same dreams,
Alright (alright)”

I got it all
’cause she is the one
Her mum calls me ‘love’,
Her dad calls me ‘son’,
Alright (alright)

Now this is some deep emotional shit…

View original 744 more words

The 2014 American Music Awards nominees are here, and Iggy Azalea dominated! With six nods, Iggy leads the nods, but she’s got some tough competition, going up against Beyonce, Katy Perry, One Direction and more!

Jason Derulo and Charli XCX announced the nominees for the 2014 American Music Awards on Good Morning America on Oct. 13, and congratulations are in order for some of our favorite stars. Iggy Azalea ruled the nominees, and we can’t wait to see her go up against the biggest names in music, including Beyonce, Luke Bryan, One Direction, Katy Perry and more at the live show at the Nokia Theatre in Los Angeles on Nov. 23. Originally posted on 101.9 AMP Radio:

First things first let’s get this out of the way.

“Out Of The Woods” is the most repetitive song of the year. It’s chorus is monotone and it’s slow. Taylor is writing another song about a past boyfriend.

There. Now let’s move on.

Now can we appreciate that the song is a detailed recollection of what Taylor was going through at a certain point in her life?

Regardless as to whether the song is about Harry Styles or her night running around with a squirrel, this girl is opening up her life for us to mirror with our own lives and play out our own stories with the ones she’s shared with us.

To really appreciate a song, dig into it and study the lyrics. As Taylor has said many times, it’s important to her that her fans love the lyrics. On more than one occasion she has stated that…

View original 549 more words

I like all of the songs actually but…

I think my fave is amnesia <3

Originally posted on Hollywood Life:

You may have expected Harry to be extremely upset after Taylor released a second song about him, but the One Direction singer doesn’t mind. In fact, Harry is shockingly defending Taylor to his friends who are dissing her, a source tells HollywoodLife.com EXCLUSIVELY!

Taylor Swift has released another song about her ex-boyfriend, Harry Styles. Yet, instead of being angry that she’s writing about him again, the One Direction hottie is actually coming to her defense after the release of “Out Of The Woods.” Harry’s friends are throwing some serious shade at Tay, and he’s not having it, HollywoodLife.com has EXCLUSIVELY learned.

View original 343 more words

Eid-ul Azha is a day on which we enjoy, eat meat and have fun but unfortunately.. this Eid was the most boring Eid of all time. I didn’t even thought that it could that boring. I made so many plans 2-3 days before eid but all of them were DESTROYED :( . OKAY! so now the question is that how did I spent my eid? what did I did? well.. actually ..nothing!!

I spent my whole day on the bed doing nothing and just watching t.v and on the other hand posting on my social media and yes….. that’s it!

My mother made some tasty things but I didn’t actually enjoyed eating it because no one was with me :( I ate my food alone ! :(

So basically this was the most boring and sick eid of my life!

I hope next eid would be better than this one (I can only hope)

Originally posted on The Swift Agency:

We are in screaming color, Taylor Nation.

Taylor has announced one lyric of each track per day until the release of 1989 on October 27.

For the next 13 days leading up to 1989, I'll be posting one lyric from each of the 13 tracks each day. #1989

— Taylor Swift (@taylorswift13) October 14, 2014

So here is the first one! Again, there’s the New York City skyline. Let the theories commence:

Watch on Instagram

“Push your belly out — like as if you’re gonna go take a poop.”

That may be the most alarming piece of advice dispensed by a guest mentor in seven seasons ofThe VoiceBattle Rounds, but I’ll be darned if Alicia Keys’ prescription for hitting a challenging high note didn’t pay off for Team Pharrell member Taylor Phelan. (Wait, is this what musicians mean by putting some stank on it?)

Global dignity day, the day of respect. Many countries in the world are giving rights to every person in their country and what I think is that every person in the world should have a dignified life everyone in this world deserves respect.

In many countries people don’t give respect to women, they think that women kind is useless but they don’t know that Behind every successful man is a woman. If people in the world start to think about their acts and think 100 times before they speak or do, then this world will be full of peace.

Everyone in this world desires to have respect but don’t care about others. LIKE SERIOUSLY ! if you want respect then give the respect to others also.

If everyone starts to give respect to others and be united.. who can even dare to do anything to anyone

DIGNITY=PEACE

love yourself and love others!

Just as her current hit “Black Widow” has hit #1 on the Rhythmic charts, Iggy Azalea is ready to outdo herself.

This Friday (tomorrow,) Iggy will premiere her new single “Beg For It” from her newly reconfigured edition of her debut album The New Classic called RE-CLASSIFIED.

RE-CLASSIFIED will be released on November 24th with 5 new singles including “Beg For It.”

We’ve made it super easy to be the first to hear Iggy’s new single “Beg For It” by playing it for you all day Friday at these fabulous times:

Originally posted on Shannon A Thompson:

When to Stop Writing

This post is inspired by a comment that happened on my Facebook Author Page recently. The other day, writer – Angie Neto – asked me a fantastic question I’m sure all writers can relate to:

“Were you nervous when you published your first novel? I have edited, rewritten and changed chapters so many times now and still doing last minute searches for errors. When do you say enough?”

My Facebook answer:

“I still get nervous. I think that’s natural. You’re working hard to share your intellectual creation. It’s nerve-racking, knowing you will be judged off of it, but it’s well worth it. But I do think – at some point – you have to step away and have beta readers and editors deal with it, and eventually, you have to turn the manuscript in, and one day, you have to know you can’t change anything…

Originally posted on Bastet and Sekhmet's Library:

fingerling, brackish, noctum, cirrus, centipede, cthulhu, malachite

Credits – Wikipedia

Tiny Finglerling sitting by the brackish water
Thought he saw a piece of malachite.
From a car nearby a radio blasted -
‘Liberty in Death’ by Noctum.

Poor Fingerling felt at a loss …
And pulling his white beard he pondered.
When,
A centipede crawled from the slimy swamp
Followed by that star-spawn – Cthulhu.

Shuddering the gnome wondered
If he’d ever live to see the morrow
And walk again under the warm sun
Admiring the wispy patterns of cirrus clouds.

Linked to:  #lqw wordle week 7

Originally posted on Bastet and Sekhmet's Library:

power failure
stumbling in the morning dark
- a drop of water

in the early morn
darker than middle ages
no power – silence
gas heater dripping water
on a power strip at night

(c) G.s.k. ’14

I’m terribly late writing my posts this morning due to my water heater, as you may have understood reading the tanka (not one of my better ones, I know).

This morning I woke as usual at 5:00 (actually 4:00  as I haven’t changed my inner clock back to real-time yet) and the light beside my bed didn’t work.  I stayed in bed a while longer thinking the problem might be a general black-out, not really that unusual … then I realized that outside my house, the street lights were on.

It became apparent that there was a short circuit somewhere in the house.  We have different power breakers to isolate different parts of…

November is here which means that the temperatures are all set to drop. For that you must try and stay warm.mostly indoors, and drink loads of coffee and hot chocolate (which also contains coffee). Coffee is that product that is consumed the most across the world specially during winters. Coffee plants are cultivated in over seventy countries, some of them being Africa, Southeast Asia, Maldives and Latin America e.t.c. Growing Coffee is not an easy task. The plants are to be properly picked,processed and dried to yield the seeds inside. Ok.. so lots of people have a question in their minds that….. Is Coffee healthy for me? well.. the answer is . YES! IT IS! since it lowers the risk of cancer the chlorogenic acid in coffee that provides protection against cancer. Coffee intake is highly protective for the cardiovascular system. Caffeine that is present in coffee has shown to improve the worst of health conditions. It helps improve the health of the blood vessels as it increases the amount of nitric oxide production. Black coffee also helps to increase the metabolism so that you burn more and more calories and fat does not accumulate in the body. The caffeine supplements help improve athletic performance. So now you got the answer that coffee really is healthy for your health and the reason to why it is :) so now drink more and more coffee and stay healthy ! :)

Originally posted on Metro:

One Direction have already recorded their X Factor performance (Rex)

One Direction were forced to record their X Factor performance TWICE on Sunday night after Harry Styles suffered a wardrobe malfunction.

They were announced as next weekend’s guest performers for the results show but pre-recorded their performance on Sunday night, no doubt owing to their hectic schedules.

And the lucky X Factor audience were treated to seeing them sing their hit Steal My Girl twice.

Why?

Harry’s shirt wasn’t quite right.

Oh Harry… (Picture: AP)

They performed their track but as soon as they’d finished, Harry was grabbed by a production staff member off stage.

Having worn a white shirt for the performance, he then swiftly returned in a black shirt.

The boys were back singing Steal My Girl for a second time before speaking to show host Dermot O’Leary afterwards, who quipped: ‘Nice shirt, Harry’.

Perhaps the black brought…

Hey there, it’s been ages since we last had a natter (no seriously – it was last month when I got over excited about candles!) Don’t worry, I haven’t given up blogging, I’ve just been busy doing things that I can’t wait to tell you about, so here goes!

Last week I spent five days in Blackpool with my mum and my little sister and it was great! To start the week we did a bit of shopping (by the end of the week we had done a lot of shopping!) and then we got doughnuts on the pier which is always an essential when you’re at the seaside.

We went to Blackpool tower, we spent the morning in the ballroom and the afternoon in the circus and it was amazing!

Of course when we were at the circus we had to get clown face paint, and on our way…

Originally posted on Variety:

There’s enough swaggering cynicism for three pictures but barely enough soul to sustain even one in Rupert Wyatt’s “The Gambler,” [pmc_film_review_snippet]a stylish, energetic but disappointingly glib remake of Karel Reisz’s still-potent 1974 drama of the same title[/pmc_film_review_snippet]. Mark Wahlberg tears into one of his meatiest roles as an English professor drowning in a sea of blackjack debts and self-destructive impulses, a born risk-taker who’s aptly described as everything from “the kind of guy that likes to lose” to “the world’s stupidest asshole.” But it’s that surfeit of macho attitude in William Monahan’s script that keeps Wahlberg from coming anywhere near James Caan’s sly brilliance in the earlier film, making this a movie of slick, surface-level pleasures that’s unpersuasive at its core. In a roll of the awards-season dice, Paramount is launching “The Gambler” Dec. 19 with a one-week Oscar-qualifying run before its Jan. 2 wide release, when the collective draw of Wahlberg and a juicy supporting cast…

Originally posted on This is Irrelevant:

Last month, the unearthly being that is Taylor Swift gifted us plebs with a new album: 1989. 

A new Taylor Swift record is something that is celebrated for two years, until the next one comes and we have something else to listen to while we cry. The two-year waiting period gives us time to analyze every song to its very core, until we feel we have literally lived Taylor Swift’s life in real time.

Thankfully, one amazing journalist (Kiley Roache) and one idiot (me) got cracking on this analysis early, as we had a coast-to-coast listening party over text message. While Kiley listened at Stanford, I jammed at NYU, and the result was a deeply comprehensive, extremely intelligent discussion.
